author: JacobCakob
title: Wind Energy is decent but has a couple issues
review:
It is a pretty alright lego set, considering it only cost me £2

Both windmills look quite recognisable as windmills despite how few pieces used for each of them, with 15 on the left and 12 on the right.

The sails can spin on both of them because they are both attached to a technic piece, which is always a plus for windmills.

I like the colours used on the left windmill, the brown, beige and dark red for the main building really brings out the white used for the sails on that particular windmill. The left windmill also uses a beige arch piece at the front which is a good way to simulate a door on a set so small.

The colours used on the right windmill is 95% white which fits in with the fact that it's meant to be a huge metal fan, the other colours it has are a grey Rotor plate, which looks nice next to the white, paired with a beige technic piece (probably used to give it some colour) to make the blades spin, it also has a black lever on top of the pole which is being used as an antenna which gives it a little more depth.

This set also comes with 2 green 2x6 plates connected together with a blue 2x2 plate which you put the windmills on top of as well as 2 plants and 2 yellow flowers to decorate those green plates to give it some colour and depth.

My Biggest Negative is that it falls over so easily if you woggle your desk or shelf at all probably due to it being front heavy. Two other negatives I have are that the white shows every piece of dust that falls on it meaning you have to clean it often and the blue 2x2 connecting plate doesn't fit at all.

In conclusion Wind Energy is decent especially for the price I got it as but has a couple issues. But I'd recommend buying it if you want a tiny vanity set for your desk or shelf or are buying a lego city.
